resources.string: Put the device horizontally, horizontally, and vertically until X/Y/Z turn green.
Please slowly drag the progress bar to the far left and right to observe whether the screen brightness changes linearly and naturally.
Each GPIO will output high and low levels alternately (1 second interval). Please check whether the output voltage of each GPIO is normal.
Move closer to the device and observe if the dot below is yellow.
Move away from the device or remain still (5 seconds) and observe if the dot below is gray.
Stay close to the device, stay active, and watch the dots below turn yellow.
Please press all the keys below in sequence.
Do the above steps show the red, green and blue screen respectively?
Each LED will light up in sequence, please observe the LED status.
Please check if the pointer changes according to the light intensity.
Please speak loudly into the microphone, check whether the pointer below swings, and whether the sound playback is normal.
Please speak into the microphone and observe whether the recording data of the following channels changes, and whether the sound playback is normal.

Use a white plane with a reflectivity of about 90%, fix the device, parallel to the target plane, keep the distance at 150mm, click the [Calibration] button, wait 15 seconds for the calibration to complete, and click [Next].

Note:
* Avoid calibrating in scenes with strong ambient light. 
* The calibration target is a white plane with a reflectivity of about 90%. 
* The module is parallel to the calibration target. 
* The default calibration distance is 150mm. 
* It should be noted that there should be no other objects in the field of view of the transmitter of the device.

Use a gray plane with a reflectivity of about 18% to fix the device, parallel to the target plane, and keep the distance at 800mm. Click the [Calibrate] button, wait for 15 seconds to complete the calibration, and click [Next].

Note:
* Avoid calibrating in scenes with strong ambient light. 
* The calibration target is a gray plane with a reflectivity of about 18%. 
* The module is parallel to the calibration target. 
* The default calibration distance is 800mm. 
* It should be noted that there should be no other objects in the field of view of the transmitter of the device.

Use a gray plane with a reflectivity of about 18% to fix the device, parallel to the target plane, and keep the distance at 300mm. Check whether the distance value obtained below is accurate (the error is less than 30mm).

Each PWM will be output in sequence according to the duty cycle configured by the parameters. Please observe whether the PWM device is working normally (the PWM device may be LED lights, motors, etc.).
Please insert the sdcard card and observe whether the following table can correctly display all device paths.
Can you hear the sound of the speaker, and there is no broken sound, noise, distortion, etc.?
Is the temperature and humidity consistent with that of a professional thermo-hygrometer?
Please observe the following serial port test results (pass in green, fail in red).
Please insert any USB device (U disk, mouse, keyboard, etc.) into the USB port to be tested in turn, and check whether the following table can correctly display all device paths.
Observe whether the Wiegand peripheral successfully receives data
Swipe the card (access control card, bus card, work card, etc.) to see if the card number can be read out correctly
